title: Plan Post-Harvest Residue Management
description: After corn harvest, a farmer needs to decide how to manage the crop residue (stalks).

tasks.description: Identify the farmer's goals (e.g., quick decomposition, erosion control, prepare for no-till planting).
Provide information on different residue management options, such as chopping, disking, or leaving the stalks standing.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent explains the pros and cons of each method.

tasks.description: Based on the goal of preparing for no-till soybeans, recommend using a stalk-chopping attachment on the combine to size the residue for faster breakdown.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent provides a relevant and practical recommendation.
